alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:23AM CDT until May 06 at 10:12AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Baron Fork River at Eldon affecting Cherokee County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Baron Fork River at Eldon. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, damaging flooding occurs. Significant areas of the Camp Egan campgrounds are flooded, including cabins. This is an extremely dangerous and life threatening situation. Impacts will exceed those seen during the flood of April 2011. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 27.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
